page.title: 15A SPORTING LIFE FOR ME
page.content: Previously most sports activities took place in the public park or on the local Grammar School fields. When it was learnt that an area of land adjacent to the park and river was to be sold, a{Sports Association}was set up to puchase the land for sports facilities. The{Angling Club} put up the purchase price of{Â£20,050}in{1981 and sold most of it to the Sports Association for{Â£15,050}keeping the rest for a fishing area. Various grants, donations, and fund raising activities help pay for the ground and its development. Much voluntary work has been done to clear and level the ground and already the{football, cricket}and{hockey {pitches}and{tennis courts}are installed, and a{bowling green}laid. The Complex's development and use is progressing satisfactorily.
